title: Is this boosting?
body: Is playing with a duo partner and climbing through the ranks boosting? I've been argueing with my friend that playing with a duo partner and climbing is not boosting as you are together as League of Legends is a team game. My friend says that playing with a friend is boosting. Is it boosting?

replies.body:
If he is like Gold 1 then yeah i would call that boosting but not bannable boosting just shamless boosting.
But nah you good fam

depends. if they are the same or similar elo than you then no. if your friend is much higher than you and is playing on a smurf or has just been placed lower at the start of the season or something, then yes it is boosting, albeit an allowed form of boosting.
If you're paying them im sure its illegal and bannable for doing so. Elo boosting where you pay for a higher rank is punishable i'm 99.9% certain Riot doesn't tolerate this.
aslong as you guys are around the same rank it is fine. I have seen plat 1's play duo only with plat 5's and got to diamond from abusing low mmr duo queue

If you are both playing on your main accounts then it is fair and you are not boosting, there are restrictions for a reason so only people 1 league apart can queue up together. If you were bronze and your friend was gold but he was playing on a silver smurf in order to play with you in ranked, then yes that is boosting.

Boosting = Paying someone to rank up your account (or ask your friend to play on your account to rank you up)

Duoing = playing with a friend/random and ranking up by normal standards
if thats "boosting" why would they have a duo queue?
